intro: Iresine flavopilosa, commonly known as the golden flame plant, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, bright orange to red leaves that often have a metallic sheen. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. It thrives in warm, humid environments and prefers well-draining soil. Iresine flavopilosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant foliage.
